title: Man seriously injured in traffic accident
content: A 54-year-old man, a resident of Marsa, sustained serious injuries after he was involved in a traffic accident in Triq il-Perit Dom Mintoff, Paola yesterday at around 9pm (2100 hrs).From initial investigations it appears that for some reason the driver who was driving a Honda Fit lost control and crashed into an electricity pole.A medical team assisted the man and was taken to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance.Magistrate Dr Monica Borg Galea LL.D. was informed and appointed an inquiry while Police investigations in connection with this incident are ongoing.

title: Man seriously injured after crashing into pole
content: A man was left with serious injuries on Saturday night after crashing his car into a pole on the pavement next to a roundabout in Paola. Police said initial investigations suggest the 54-year-old man from Marsa lost control of the Honda Fit he was driving, leading him to crash into the roadside pole on Triq il-Perit Dom Mintoff. The man, a Marsa resident, was treated at the scene before being taken to Mater Dei Hospital, where his injuries were certified as serious. Investigations are continuing.

title: Motorbike driver and cyclist suffer grievous injuries in Żabbar
content: A motorbike driver and a teenage cyclist both suffered grievous injuries in an accident in Żabbar The incident happened at around the same time as hundreds of bicycles and motorcyclists were arriving from the Our Lady of Graces Pilgrimage that ends in Żabbar.  A police statement stated that the incident occurred at approximately 1:30 p.m. at Triq Bajada.  "Preliminary investigations show that the incedent involved a Honda motorbike driven by a 52-year-old man from Żabbar and a 14-year-old boy on a bicycle also from Żabbar".   "After a medical team provided first aid, they were taken to hospital and were certified to be suffering from grievous injuries" the police statement said.  Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Woman grievously injured in traffic accident
content: A 29-year-old Spanish woman, at around 1215hrs, was taken to the Gozo General Hospital because she was injured in a traffic accident in Republic Street, Victoria, Gozo.Preliminary investigations showed that the victim was hit by Mazda 2, which was being driven by a woman a 64-year-old resident of Rabat, Gozo.The woman was assisted by a medical team, taken to hospital by ambulance and certified that she was grievously injured.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcycle accident in St Paul’s Bay
content: A 44-year-old Japanese woman who resides in Birkirkara, at around 1930hrs, was taken to Mater Dei Hospital because she was injured in a traffic accident in Triq San Pawl, St Paul’s Bay.Preliminary investigations showed that a 44-year-old German man who lives in St Julian’s was driving a Voge 300Rally motorcycle, lost control and fell. The woman was a pillion rider on the motorcycle.They were assisted by a medical team, and the woman was taken to hospital by ambulance where she was certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Man suffers serious injuries in traffic accident
content: A 52-year-old man from Żurrieq, at around 2330hrs, was taken to Mater Dei Hospital after suffering injuries in a traffic accident in a parking lot on Triq il-Mina ta’ Hompesch, Ħaż-Żabbar.Initial investigations revealed that the victim was hit by a Toyota Vitz, which was being driven by a 26-year-old man resident in Kalkara.The man was treated by a medical team, taken to hospital by ambulance and certified as having suffered serious injuries.Magistrate Dr Philip Galea Farrugia LL.D was informed of the case and an inquiry was opened, while investigations by the Police are still ongoing.

title: Pedestrian injured in Victoria accident
content: A 29-year-old Spanish woman was seriously injured when she was hit by a car in Republic Street, Victoria, Gozo on Tuesday afternoon. The police said the accident happened at 12.15pm. The pedestrian was hit by a Mazda 2 driven by a 69-year-old woman from Victoria. She was hospitalised.  The police are investigating.

title: 52-year-old pedestrian seriously injured after being hit by a car in Żabbar
content: A man was seriously injured after he was hit by a car in a parking area in Żabbar on Tuesday evening.  According to the police, the accident happened at 11.30 pm in a parking area in Triq il-Mina ta’Hompesch, when a 52-year-old man from Żurrieq was hit by a Toyota Vitz driven by a 26-year-old man from Kalkara.  The pedestrian was taken to Mater Dei Hospital, where he was certified to be suffering from serious injuries.  Magistrate Philip Galea Farrugia is leading an inquiry, and police investigations into the accident are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist seriously injured in Bormla crash
content: A motorcyclist was seriously injured after he was involved in a collision with a car in Bormla on Thursday evening.  A police statement said the accident happened on Triq San Ġwann t'Għuxa at 8.45pm, when a 54-year-old motorcyclist from Żabbar riding a Honda motorbike was involved in a collision with a Hyundai I30 driven by a 34-year-old man from Msida.  A medical team was called to the scene, and the motorcyclist was taken to Mater Dei Hospital via ambulance. He was later certified as having suffered serious The motorcyclist was seen by a medical team on site and later taken to Mater Dei Hospital, where he was certified suffering serious injuries.  Magistrate Monica Borg Galea is leading an inquiry, and police investigations into the accident are ongoing.

title: Arrested following a traffic accident in Gozo
content: A 30-year-old Englishman is being detained after he allegedly stole a motorcycle in Gozo and shortly afterwards was involved in a collision with the same motorcycle.At around 1330 hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq L-Għarb, Għarb. Police went immediately on site where they found that an accident had occurred between two motorcycles, a Honda and a Kymco, and the Honda driver, a 34-year-old man from Xagħra, needed medical assistance.At this point, persons who were on site informed the police that the Kymco driver, probably a British national, fled the scene. A search immediately began, and shortly afterwards he was found in the vicinity of the accident and was arrested. During the arrest he was aggressive towards the police, who were not injured.During investigations, the Police found that the Kymco motorcycle had just been stolen from Sannat, allegedly from the same British man who was involved in the traffic accident and then fled the scene.The two men were taken to the Gozo General Hospital because of the injuries they sustained in the accident, where the 34-year-old man was later certified to have sustained grievous injuries, while the condition of the arrested person is still pending.Police investigations into this case are ongoing.

title: Man arrested after stealing motorcycle, crashing with it and fleeing the scene
content: A 30-year-old has been arrested after he stole a motorcycle, crashed with it and fled the scene.The police confirmed that the British national was arrested earlier today in Gozo after he was allegedly involved in a traffic accident with the same motorcycle he stole.The accident took place at around 1:30pm in Triq l-Għarb, Għarb.Police officers showed up at the scene where two motorcycles had collided, with one of the cyclists, a 34-year-old from Xagħra needing medical assistance.At the point, police were informed by witnesses that the British national had fled the scene, after which they immediately began looking for him.He was found a while later near the scene and was arrested. During the arrest, he was violent with the police officers, but no one was injured.During their investigations, police found a motorcycle that had just been stolen in Sannat, allegedly by the man who was arrested.Both motorcyclists were taken to Gozo General Hospital due to injuries they suffered during the accident.The 34-year-old suffered grievous injuries while the other man’s condition is still pending.Police investigations are still ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist arrested after Gozo bike theft ends in crash
content: A British man was arrested in Gozo on Saturday after allegedly stealing a motorbike in Sannat and later crashing it into another bike in Għarb, leaving one rider grievously injured. Police said the 30-year old suspect was riding a stolen Kymco motorbike when it was involved in a collision with a Honda motorbike driven by a 34-year old man from Xagħra at around 1.30pm in Triq l-Għarb. The Honda rider was certified as being grievously injured. Witnesses reported that the Kymco rider fled the scene on foot. A search was launched, and officers soon tracked him down nearby. Police said the man was “aggressive towards the police” during his arrest, though no officers were injured. Both riders were taken to Gozo General Hospital for treatment. The British man’s condition remains pending. Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Pedestrian injured in Pieta' traffic accident
content: A 77-year-old woman was seriously injured in an accident in Pieta' on Sunday. The police said the accident happened at 8.30am at Sa Maison. The woman was hit by a Hyundai I10 car driven by a 75-year-old man from Sliema.  She was hospitalised.

title: Woman grievously injured in traffic accident
content: A 77-year-old woman residing in Valletta, at around 0830hrs, was taken to Mater Dei Hospital because she was injured in a traffic accident in Sa Maison Street, Tal-Pietà.Preliminary investigations showed that the victim was hit by a Hyundai I10, which was being driven by a 75-year-old man residing in Tas-Sliema.The woman was assisted by a medical team, taken to hospital by ambulance and certified that she was grievously injured.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist injured in hit-and-run
content: The police are on the lookout for a motorist who allegedly drove on after hitting a motorcyclist in San Ġwann on Monday evening. The accident happened in Bella Vista Street at about 7pm and involved a Renault Megane and a Honda motorcycle. The 42-year-old driver of the motorcycle was seriously injured and hoispitalised. A magisterial inquiry is underway.

title: Elderly woman injured as car crashes into a wall
content: A woman, 81 from Sta Venera, was seriously injured on Wednesday morning when the car she was travelling in crashed into a wall. The accident happened in Triq Marsalforn, Gozo, at 8am. The car, a Toyota Corolla, was being driven by an 82-year-old man from Zabbar. The police are investigating.

title: Gozo traffic accident
content: Today, at around 0800 hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq Marsalforn, Żebbuġ, Gozo.From initial investigations, it showed that an 82-year-old man from Ħaż-Żabbar lost control of the Toyota Corolla he was driving and crashed into a wall. An 81-year-old woman from Santa Venera was also in the vehicle.The woman was assisted by a medical team on site and taken to Gozo General Hospital by an ambulance, where she was certified to have sustained grievous injuries.The Police are carrying out investigations.

title: Elderly pedestrian grievously injured in Gozo traffic accident
content: A 70-year-old man from St Julian’s was grievously injured in a traffic accident in Rabat, Gozo, on Thursday afternoon. The accident happened at around 2.15pm in Triq ir-Repubblika, when the man was hit by a Lintex HT125T-28 motorcycle driven by a 58-year-old man from Rabat, Gozo. Both men were assisted by a medical team at the scene. The elderly man was then taken to Gozo General Hospital by ambulance, where doctors certified him as suffering from grievous injuries. Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist grievously injured in Marsascala accident
content: A biker was grievously injured on Thursday evening after he was involved in a collision with a car in Marsascala.  According to police preliminary investigations, the accident happened at 6pm in Triq Sant Antnin and involved a Toyota Passo driven by a 28-year-old woman from Marsascala, and a Kymco Agility motorbike ridden by a 33-year-old man from Tarxien. The motorcyclist was taken to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance, where he was certified to have sustained grievous injuries. Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Man grievously injured in traffic accident
content: A 70-year-old man residing in St Julian’s, at around 1415hrs, was taken to Gozo General Hospital because he was injured in a traffic accident in Republic Street, Victoria, Gozo.Preliminary investigations showed that the victim was hit by a Lintex HT125T-28 motorcycle, which was being driven by a 58-year-old man residing in Rabat, Gozo.The men were assisted by a medical team and the elderly man was taken to hospital by ambulance, where he was certified to have suffered grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Man grievously injured in traffic accident
content: A 36-year-old Albanian man, from Marsascala, was taken to Mater Dei Hospital at around 1000 hrs following a traffic accident in Triq Għar Dalam, Birzebbugia.From initial investigations, it appears that the victim was hit by a Toyota Dyna van, which was being driven by a 59-year-old man from Marsa.The Albanian was assisted by a medical team and taken to hospital by an ambulance, where he was certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Car overturns on Mrieħel bypass
content: A car overturned on the Mrieħel bypass on Thursday afternoon.   The blue Fiat seems not to have been involved in a collision with another vehicle.  Police said that the road wardens- LESA took the lead at the scene.   Generally, the Police take over a traffic accident when there are injuries.   For some minutes, both lanes of traffic in the busy main road were closed, but after officials swept the area and removed the shattererd glass that scattered on the road, one lane of traffic re-opened.   Witnesses on site said traffic was flowing.

title: Motorcyclist grievously injured in early morning Gozo crash
content: A motorcyclist was grievously injured in an early morning accident in Qala, Gozo on Thursday. The 47-year old man from Nadur, who was riding a Honda NSC motorbike, was involved in a collision with a Kia Picanto driven by a 53-year old woman from Qala. The accident happened at 5.30am in Triq l-Imġarr. A medical team was called on site. The motorcyclist was taken to Gozo General Hospital by ambulance where he was certified to have sustained grievous injuries. Police investigations are under way.

title: Traffic accident
content: This morning, at around 0530 hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq L-Imġarr, Qala, Gozo.The Police went immediately on site and from preliminary investigations it resulted that a collision had occurred between a Kia Picanto that was being driven by a 53-year-old woman from Qala and a Honda NSC motorcycle that was being driven by a 47-year-old man, a resident of Nadur.A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the motorcyclist to Gozo General Hospital. He was later certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Woman greviously injured in traffic accident
content: A 36-year-old Italian woman, resident in St Paul’s Bay, was taken to Mater Dei Hospital at around 8:45 a.m. due to injuries sustained in a traffic accident in Triq Sant’ Andrija, St Julian’s.Preliminary investigations showed that while she was riding a Kymco Like motorcycle, lost control and fell, subsequently colliding with a Toyota Tercel that was being driven in the same direction by a 71-year-old man from San Ġwann.She was assisted by a medical team and taken to the hospital by ambulance, where she was later certified as having sustained grevious injuries.Police investigations are still ongoing.

title: Passengers injured in unfortunate crash
content: A woman and two children were injured late on Saturday when their car was hit by a vehicle which was involved in a crash in the opposite lane. The accident happened on the Gudja Bypass at 11pm. The police explained that the first collision involved a Suzuki Baleno driven by a 49-year-old man from Swieqi and a Hyundai Getz driven by a 19-year-old man from San Ġwann. The Hyundai ended up in the opposite lane where it crashed into a Renault Captur. The Renault was being driven by a 50-year-old man accompanied by two women aged 69 and 43 and a boy and girl, both aged 14, all residents of Rabat. The 43-year-old woman and the children were hospitalised, with the boy suffering a serious injury, police said. The others suffered slight injuries. The police are investigating.

title: Traffic accident in Gudja
content: Late yesterday evening, at around 11:00 p.m. (2300hrs), the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq Dawret il-Gudja, Gudja.Police immediately went to the scene, and from preliminary investigations it resulted that a collision had occurred between a Suzuki Baleno driven by a 49-year-old man from Swieqi and a Hyundai Getz driven by a 19-year-old from San Ġwann. Followwing the intial impact, the Hyundai veered into the opposite lane and collided with a Renault Captur.The Renault was driven by a 50-year-old man. Also inside the vehicle were two women aged 69 and 43, as well as a 14-year-old girl and a 14-year-old boy, all residents of Rabat.A medical team was called to the scene, and an ambulance took the 43-year-old woman together with the two children to Mater Dei Hospital. Later, the 14-year-old boy was certified to have suffered grievous injuries, while the girl and the 43-year-old woman suffered slight injuries.Police investigations into this accident are still ongoing.

title: Traffic accident in Siġġiewi
content: Yesterday, at around 2:30 p.m. (1430hrs), the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq Ta’ Lawrenti, Siġġiewi.Police immediately went to the scene, and from preliminary investigations it resulted that a collision had occurred between a Smart Fortwo driven by a 34-year-old woman from Mellieħa and a Volvo XC40 driven by a 38-year-old man from Qrendi.A medical team was called to the site, and the woman was taken to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance. Later, she was certified as having sustained grevious injuries.Police investigations are still ongoing.

title: Motorist admits drink-driving and fleeing the scene of an accident
content: A 34-year-old drink-driver who hit a motorcyclist and sped away from the scene was fined €3,000 and had his driving licence suspended for six months on Tuesday. The accident happened on the roundabout of Saqqajja Hill on Sunday. Mario Mifsud, a chef from Qormi, appeared in court on Tuesday accused of driving in a reckless, negligent or dangerous manner, damaging a motorcycle, injuring the motorcyclist and driving under the influence. He was also accused of leaving the scene of the collision. Police inspector Nathan Bugeja explained that the motorcyclist was waiting at the roundabout when he was hit by the car driven by the accused. The driver stopped and upon seeing the victim on the ground, got back in his car and sped off. He then turned up at Qormi police station half an hour later with his father and brother. He smelt of alcohol but refused to take a breathalyser test after consulting with his lawyer. On Tuesday afternoon, he pleaded guilty to the charges. Magistrate Charmaine Galea, found him guilty by his own admission, fined him €3,000 and suspended his driving licence for six months. The court also imposed a 12-point penalty on his licence. Police inspector Nathan Bugeja prosecuted while lawyer Roberto Montalto assisted the accused.

title: Woman grievously injured in a traffic accident
content: An 84-year-old woman, a resident of Naxxar, was hospitalised at 0930 hrs after being injured in a traffic accident in Triq il-Kappella Ta’ Xagħra, Naxxar.It resulted from initial investigations that the victim was hit by Hyundai Excel, that was being driven by an 84-year-old man from Naxxar.The woman was assisted by a medical team and taken to hospital by ambulance, where she was certified to be suffering from grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist seriously injured in Żurrieq crash
content: A motorcyclist was left with serious injuries after being involved in a traffic collision with a car in Żurrieq on Thursday morning. Preliminary investigations suggest a collision had occurred between the Piaggio Beverly motorbike driven by the injured party, a 61-year-old man from Mqabba, and a Toyota Aqua driven by a 67-year-old woman from Żurrieq. The incident occurred on Triq il-Belt Valletta at around 9.30am, police said. The motorcyclist was treated at the scene before being taken to Mater Dei Hospital, where his injuries were certified as serious. Magistrate Monica Borg Galea was informed of the incident and opened an inquiry into the case. Police investigations are still ongoing.

title: Collision between a car and a motorbike in Żurrieq
content: Today, at around 0930hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident on Triq il-Belt Valletta, Żurrieq.The Police immediately went to the scene and from a preliminary investigation it resulted that a collision had occurred between a Toyota Aqua driven by a 67-year-old woman resident of Żurrieq and a Piaggio Beverly motorbike driven by a 61-year-old man from Mqabba.A medical team was called to the scene and an ambulance took the motorbike driver to Mater Dei Hospital, where he was certified to be seriously injured.Magistrate Dr Monica Borg Galea LL.D was informed and appointed an inquiry while Police investigations are still ongoing.

title: Car catches fire on Floriana main road, causing standstill traffic
content: A man was driving on the Floriana main road when his car caught fire on Thursday afternoon.   A police spokesperson said the driver is uninjured and the firefighters were able to extinguish the blaze soon after they arrived at Triq Sant Anna.   Readers in the area said they were caught in standstill traffic as police made their best efforts to direct oncoming vehicles.  "Even a snail was travelling faster than us," a frustrated commuter told Times of Malta. Triq Sant Anna connects Valletta to the rest of Malta and is among the island's busier roads.  Most of Malta's buses pass through that road.

title: Watch: Traffic accident caught live on air during live Transport Malta interview
content: Malta’s traffic woes were brought home to TV viewers live on air after a minor accident was caught on camera during a roadside TVM interview with a Transport Malta official. The footage shows a silver vehicle crashing into the back of a red car in front as the latter stops at a Paola roundabout, as Transport Malta’s (TM) deputy head of enforcement Jean Claude Attard is interviewed in the foreground live on TVM. Attard appears startled at the sound of the accident before looking around to the scene of the bumper-to-bumper in the background, while the presenter continues speaking. The accident occurred just moments after the presenter said the pair were “here in the early hours of the morning, when traffic seems to be at its peak – which is normal for the country”.  Reacting to the incident, Attard tells the presenter: “As you can see, these things happen on the go, as behind us, we have a bumper-to-bumper which can take a while to clear the vehicles from the street”. He added that TM officials would “place markers on the ground of where the crash happened to move the cars as fast as possible” in addition to their duties directing traffic at what he described as “one of the busiest junctions in the south”. TM officials can be seen attending the scene shortly after the incident occurs. Thursday’s on-air accident comes as Malta continues to battle perennial congestion and frustration on the roads. On Tuesday, gridlock was particularly bad across the country as Malta registered 23 collisions, 10 vehicle breakdowns and two separate spillages across the island during morning rush hour. Motorists reported spending more than double the usual time on their commutes, and many took to social media to express frustration, complaining about standstill traffic that stretched even onto non-arterial roads. The issue spilt over into parliamentary proceedings later that day when Opposition Leader Alex Borg quipped to Robert Abela that he was delayed because, due to not being escorted like the prime minister, he was stuck in traffic.

title: Għajnsielem mayor urges traffic safety measures after latest road accident
content: The Mayor of Għajnsielem on Friday called on the authorities to install speed cameras and traffic calming measures along Triq l-Imġarr after a four-vehicle collision left two people in hospital. One person suffered grievous injuries while another sustained light injuries in the accident, the latest in a string of “serious accidents” along that stretch of road which led mayor Kevin Cauchi to make his heartfelt appeal to the authorities. The accident, which happened around 9am, involved a Mitsubishi L200 driven by a 35-year old man from Xagħra and a Suzuki GSXR driven by a 43-year old man from Nadur. A 19-year old man also from Nadur was riding pillion. A Toyota Corolla driven by a 67-year old man from Qala and an Alfa Romeo driven by a 55-year old man from Munxar were also damaged in the collision. A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the 43-year old man and the 19-year old youth to the Gozo General Hospital for treatment. Magistrate Brigitte Sultana appointed an inquiry as police investigations continued.  Writing in a social media post following the accident, Għajnsielem mayor Kevin Cauchi expressed his frustration at the lack of inaction following the latest accident on this stretch of road. “Another serious accident took place this morning on Triq l-Imġarr. The statistics speak for themselves yet still nothing is being done,” he said. He pointed out the local council has been appealing with the authority “for years” to install speed cameras, plastic bollards and other traffic calming measures along Triq l- Imġarr and other main roads.
